title: Professional UI polish + Hero top-left creator credit

requirements.summary: Add a top-left "Created By Arion Zi" credit label to the Hero top bar opposite AuthControls without affecting auth behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: On the landing (Hero) section, a visible text label "Created By Arion Zi" appears in the top-left area of the page.
The existing AuthControls remain accessible in the top-right area and keep their current behavior (sign in/out, focus management).
The credit label is readable on mobile and desktop, does not overlap other UI elements, and maintains the siteâ€™s existing dark/neon theme styling (subtle, professional).

file_operations.description: Update the Hero section top bar layout from right-aligned-only to a two-sided bar (left credit label + right AuthControls). Ensure responsive wrapping/spacing so the label never overlaps AuthControls and remains readable on small screens. Keep AuthControls ref wiring and behavior unchanged. Uses existing shadcn/ui-based AuthControls; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a small, theme-consistent utility/style (e.g., a shared class for top-bar microcopy) to keep the credit label subtle (muted foreground, tracking, and spacing) while preserving the existing dark/neon identity. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Polish UI consistency across major sections (spacing, typography hierarchy, alignment, and component styling consistency) without changing feature behavior or gated flows.
acceptanceCriteria: Section layouts use consistent max-widths and horizontal padding so content aligns cleanly between sections on desktop and mobile.
Headings/subheadings/body text have a more consistent hierarchy (sizes/weights/line-height), and the overall readability is improved without changing the meaning of existing user-facing text.
Cards, buttons, and link styles look consistent across sections (e.g., consistent radii, shadows, border treatments), while preserving the existing premium dark/neon visual identity.
No changes break existing flows: login/logout, plan selection, gated generator actions, generation outputs, copy/share, template selection, and card export all still work as before.

file_operations.description: Introduce shared layout/typography helper classes in Tailwind layers (e.g., consistent section padding, shared container widths, and standardized section heading/subheading styles) to align content across sections while preserving the neon/dark theme variables. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align Hero spacing/typography with the new shared section/container styles (consistent max-width, improved heading/subheading rhythm) without altering CTA click behavior or auth prompt logic. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Normalize section/container spacing and typography hierarchy (header block, descriptions, form spacing) to match the new shared styles without changing validation, gating, randomize, copy/share, or generation behavior. Uses existing shadcn/ui Card/Form controls; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Apply consistent section heading styles and card spacing/alignment (grid gaps, button alignment) to match the shared style system without changing copy/share/export behavior. Uses existing shadcn/ui Card/Button; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Unify heading/subheading styling and grid spacing; ensure template cards and preview card align with the shared container widths and consistent card treatments, without changing template selection behavior. Uses existing shadcn/ui Card; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure pricing section alignment (container width, card spacing, heading hierarchy) matches other sections; keep plan selection logic and disabled states unchanged. Uses existing shadcn/ui Card/Button/Badge; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Standardize section padding, heading styles, filter control alignment, and card typography to match the shared styles without changing filtering behavior. Uses existing shadcn/ui Select/Card/Badge; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Bring FAQ section spacing, heading hierarchy, and accordion item layout into alignment with the shared style system without changing FAQ content or accordion behavior. Uses existing shadcn/ui Accordion; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Normalize legal sections spacing and typography hierarchy (titles, subheads, prose spacing) to match other sections while keeping the same text/meaning and anchor IDs intact. Uses existing shadcn/ui Card; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align footer container width, link typography, and spacing with the shared layout system while preserving existing links and attribution behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
